snippet: Leung Chun-ying pledged to help produce 100,000 new units of housing by streamlining approvals, opening up undeveloped lands for housing and even tapping rock caverns for development.
abstract: Hong Kong chief executive Leung Chun-Ying uses his first policy address to outline series of populist proposals to alleviate severe housing shortages and air pollution that have bedeviled city; address comes amid increasing criticism of his administration, centering on his perceived close ties to Chinese leadership.

byline.original: By GERRY MULLANY and KEITH BRADSHER

lead_paragraph: Leung Chun-ying pledged to help produce 100,000 new units of housing by streamlining approvals, opening up undeveloped lands for housing and even tapping rock caverns for development.

headline.seo: Leung Chun-ying, Hong Kong Leader, Pledges to Ease Housing Shortage
headline.main: Leader Issues Populist Vows in Hong Kong
headline.print_headline: Leader Issues Populist Vows In Hong Kong
